member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL
member.summary: Contains all of the Phonon Library's functions.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.Vector3
member.summary: A point or vector in 3D space. Steam Audio uses a right-handed coordinate system, with the positive x-axis pointing right, the positive y-axis pointing up, and the negative z-axis pointing ahead. Position and direction data obtained from a game engine or audio engine must be properly transformed before being passed to any Steam Audio API function.

member.summary: The z-coordinate.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.SceneType
member.summary: The types of scenes that can be created. Each scene type corresponds to a different ray tracing implementation.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SceneType.Default
member.summary: Steam Audio's built-in ray tracer. Supports multi-threading. Runs on all platforms that Steam Audio supports.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SceneType.Embree
member.summary: The Intel Embree ray tracer. Supports multi-threading. This is a highly optimized implementation, and is likely to be faster than the default ray tracer. However, Embree requires Windows, Linux, or macOS, and a 32-bit x86 or 64-bit x86_64 CPU.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SceneType.RadeonRays
member.summary: The AMD Radeon Rays ray tracer. This is an OpenCL implementation, and can use either the CPU or any GPU that supports OpenCL 1.2 or later. If using the GPU, it is likely to be significantly faster than the default ray tracer. However, with heavy real-time simulation workloads, it may impact your application's frame rate. On supported AMD GPUs, you can use the Resource Reservation feature to mitigate this issue.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SceneType.Custom
member.summary: Allows you to specify callbacks to your own ray tracer. Useful if your application already uses a high-performance ray tracer. This option uses the least amount of memory at run-time, since it does not have to build any ray tracing data structures of its own.

member.summary: The type of HRTF to use.

member.summary: The built-in HRTF.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.HrtfType.Sofa
member.summary: An HRTF loaded from a SOFA file.

member.summary: Volume normalization types to use.

member.summary: No normalization.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.HrtfNormType.Rms
member.summary: Root-mean squared normalization. Normalize HRTF volume to ensure similar volume from all directions based on root-mean-square value of each HRTF.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.HrtfInterpolation
member.summary: Techniques for interpolating HRTF data. This is used when rendering a point source whose position relative to the listener is not contained in the measured HRTF data.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.HrtfInterpolation.Nearest
member.summary: Nearest-neighbor filtering, i.e., no interpolation. Selects the measurement location that is closest to the source's actual location.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.HrtfInterpolation.Bilinear
member.summary: Bilinear filtering. Incurs a relatively high CPU overhead as compared to nearest-neighbor filtering, so use this for sounds where it has a significant benefit. Typically, bilinear filtering is most useful for wide-band noise-like sounds, such as radio static, mechanical noise, fire, etc.

member.summary: Apply frequency-independent distance attenuation.

member.summary: Apply frequency-dependent air absorption as a function of distance.

member.summary: Modes of applying transmission effects.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.TransmissionType.FrequencyIndependent

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.TransmissionType.FrequencyDependent

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectType
member.summary: Type of reflection effect algorithm to use.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectType.Convolution
member.summary: Multi-channel convolution reverb. Reflections reaching the listener are encoded in an Impulse Response (IR), which is a filter that records each reflection as it arrives. This algorithm renders reflections with the most detail, but may result in significant CPU usage. Using a reflection mixer with this algorithm provides a reduction in CPU usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectType.Parametric
member.summary: Parametric (or artificial) reverb, using feedback delay networks. The reflected sound field is reduced to a few numbers that describe how reflected energy decays over time. This is then used to drive an approximate model of reverberation in an indoor space. This algorithm results in lower CPU usage, but cannot render individual echoes, especially in outdoor spaces. A reflection mixer cannot be used with this algorithm.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectType.Hybrid
member.summary: A hybrid of convolution and parametric reverb. The initial portion of the IR is rendered using convolution reverb, but the later part is used to estimate a parametric reverb. The point in the IR where this transition occurs can be controlled. This algorithm allows a trade-off between rendering quality and CPU usage. An reflection mixer cannot be used with this algorithm.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectType.Tan
member.summary: Multi-channel convolution reverb, using AMD TrueAudio Next for GPU acceleration. This algorithm is similar to @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTYPE_CONVOLUTION, but uses the GPU instead of the CPU for processing, allowing significantly more sources to be processed. A reflection mixer must be used with this algorithm, because the GPU will process convolution reverb at a single point in your audio processing pipeline.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationType
member.summary: The different algorithms for generating probes.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationType.Centroid
member.summary: Generates a single probe at the center of the specified box.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationType.UniformFloor
member.summary: Generates probes that are uniformly-spaced, at a fixed height above solid geometry. A probe will never be generated above another probe unless there is a solid object between them. The goal is to model floors or terrain, and generate probes that are a fixed height above the floor or terrain, and uniformly-spaced along the horizontal plane. This algorithm is not suitable for scenarios where the listener may fly into a region with no probes; if this happens, the listener will not be influenced by any of the baked data.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataVariation
member.summary: The different ways in which the source and listener positions used to generate baked data can vary as a function of probe position.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataVariation.Reverb
member.summary: At each probe, baked data is calculated with both the source and the listener at the probe position. This is useful for modeling traditional reverbs, which depend only on the listener's position (or only on the source's position).

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataVariation.StaticSource
member.summary: At each probe, baked data is calculated with the source at some fixed position (specified separately), and the listener at the probe position. This is used for modeling reflections from a static source to any point within the probe batch.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataVariation.StaticListener
member.summary: At each probe, baked data is calculated with the source at the probe position, and the listener at some fixed position (specified separately). This is used for modeling reflections from a moving source to a static listener.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataVariation.Dynamic
member.summary: Baked data is calculated for each pair of probes. For example, this is used for calculating paths between every pair of probes in a batch.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataType
member.summary: The types of baked data that can be stored in a probe batch.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataType.Reflections
member.summary: Reflections. The source and listener positions used to compute the reflections data stored at each probe depends on the @c IPLBakedDataVariation selected.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataType.Pathing
member.summary: Pathing. The probe batch stores data about the shortest paths between any pair of probes in the batch.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeFlags
member.summary: Flags for specifying what types of reflections data to bake.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeFlags.BakeConvolution
member.summary: Bake impulse responses for @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_CONVOLUTION, @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_HYBRID, or @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_TAN.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeFlags.BakeParametric
member.summary: Bake parametric reverb for @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_PARAMETRIC or @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_HYBRID.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationFlags.Reflections

member.summary: Enable pathing simulation.

member.summary: Flags indicating which types of direct simulation should be enabled for a given @c IPLSource.

member.summary: Enable air absorption calculations.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModelType
member.summary: The types of distance attenuation that can be used.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModelType.Default
member.summary: The default distance attenuation model. This is an inverse distance falloff, with all sounds within 1 meter of the listener rendered without distance attenuation.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModelType.InverseDistance
member.summary: An inverse distance falloff. You can configure the minimum distance, within which distance attenuation is not applied.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModelType.Callback
member.summary: An arbitrary distance falloff function, defined by a callback function.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModelType
member.summary: The types of air absorption that can be used.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModelType.Default
member.summary: The default air absorption model. This is an exponential falloff, with decay rates derived from physical properties of air.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModelType.Exponential
member.summary: An exponential falloff. You can configure the decay rates for each frequency band.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModelType.Callback
member.summary: An arbitrary air absorption model, defined by a callback function.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.OcclusionType
member.summary: The different algorithms for simulating occlusion.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.OcclusionType.Raycast
member.summary: Raycast occlusion. A single ray is traced from the listener to the source. If the ray hits a solid object before it reaches the source, the source is considered occluded.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.OcclusionType.Volumetric
member.summary: A volumetric occlusion algorithm that can model partial occlusion. The source is modeled as a sphere with a configurable radius. Multiple points are sampled within the volume of this sphere. Rays are then traced from each sample point to both the source and the listener. A sample point is considered occluded if either of these two rays is occluded. The occlusion value for the source is calculated as the fraction of sample points that are unoccluded. This algorithm allows for smoother transitions in and out of occlusion.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ContextSettings.Version
member.summary: The API version used by the caller. Context creation will fail if `phonon.dll` does not implement a compatible version of the API. Typically, this should be set to `STEAMAUDIO_VERSION`.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ContextSettings.LogCallback
member.summary: (Optional) If non-NULL, Steam Audio will call this function to record log messages generated by certain operations.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ContextSettings.AllocateCallback
member.summary: (Optional) If non-NULL, Steam Audio will call this function whenever it needs to allocate memory.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ContextSettings.FreeCallback
member.summary: (Optional) If non-NULL, Steam Audio will call this function whenever it needs to free memory.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ContextSettings.SimdLevel
member.summary: The maximum SIMD instruction set level that Steam Audio should use. Steam Audio automatically chooses the best instruction set to use based on the user's CPU, but you can prevent it from using certain newer instruction sets using this parameter. For example, with some workloads, AVX512 instructions consume enough power that the CPU clock speed will be throttled, resulting in lower performance than expected. If you observe this in your application, set this parameter to `IPL_SIMDLEVEL_AVX2` or lower.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ContextSettings.Flags

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.OpenCLDeviceSettings
member.summary: Specifies requirements that an OpenCL device must meet in order to be considered when listing OpenCL devices.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.OpenCLDeviceSettings.Type
member.summary: The type of device. Set to @c IPL_OPENCLDEVICETYPE_ANY to consider all available devices.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.OpenCLDeviceSettings.NumCUsToReserve
member.summary: The number of GPU compute units (CUs) that should be reserved for use by Steam Audio. If set to a non-zero value, then a GPU will be included in the device list only if it can reserve at least this many CUs. Set to 0 to indicate that Steam Audio can use the entire GPU, in which case all available GPUs will be considered.
member.remarks: Ignored if @c type is @c IPL_OPENCLDEVICETYPE_CPU.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.OpenCLDeviceSettings.FractionCUsForIRUpdate
member.summary: The fraction of reserved CUs that should be used for impulse response (IR) update. IR update includes: a) ray tracing using Radeon Rays to simulate sound propagation, and/or b) pre-transformation of IRs for convolution using TrueAudio Next. Steam Audio will only list GPU devices that are able to subdivide the reserved CUs as per this value. The value must be between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: For example, if @c numCUsToReserve is @c 8, and @c fractionCUsForIRUpdate is @c 0.5f, then 4 CUs will be used for IR update and 4 CUs will be used for convolution. Below are typical scenarios:- Using only TrueAudio Next. Set @c fractionCUsForIRUpdate to @c 0.5f. This ensures that reserved CUs are available for IR update as well as convolution.- Using TrueAudio Next and Radeon Rays for real-time simulation and rendering. Choosing @c fractionCUsForIRUpdate may require some experimentation to utilize reserved CUs optimally. You can start by setting @c fractionCUsForIRUpdate to @c 0.5f. However, if IR calculation has high latency with these settings, increase @c fractionCUsForIRUpdate to use more CUs for ray tracing.- Using only Radeon Rays. Set @c fractionCUsForIRUpdate to @c 1, to make sure all the reserved CUs are used for ray tracing. If using Steam Audio for preprocessing (e.g. baking reverb), then consider setting @c numCUsToReserve to @c 0 to use the entire GPU for accelerated ray tracing.Ignored if @c type is @c IPL_OPENCLDEVICETYPE_CPU or @c numCUsToReserve is @c 0.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.OpenCLDeviceSettings.RequiresTAN
member.summary: If @c IPL_TRUE, then the GPU device must support TrueAudio Next. It is not necessary to set this to @c IPL_TRUE if @c numCUsToReserve or @c fractionCUsForIRUpdate are set to non-zero values.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.Triangle
member.summary: A triangle in 3D space.
member.remarks: Triangles are specified by their three vertices, which are in turn specified using indices into a vertex array.Steam Audio uses a counter-clockwise winding order. This means that when looking at the triangle such that the normal is pointing towards you, the vertices are specified in counter-clockwise order.Each triangle must be specified using three vertices; triangle strip or fan representations are not supported.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Triangle.Indices
member.summary: Indices of the three vertices of this triangle.

member.summary: The acoustic properties of a surface.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Material.Absorption
member.summary: Fraction of sound energy absorbed at low, middle, high frequencies. Between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Material.Scattering
member.summary: Fraction of sound energy scattered in a random direction on reflection. Between 0.0 (pure specular) and 1.0 (pure diffuse).

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Material.Transmission
member.summary: Fraction of sound energy transmitted through at low, middle, high frequencies. Between 0.0 and 1.0. Only used for direct occlusion calculations.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.Hit
member.summary: Information about a ray's intersection with 3D geometry.
member.remarks: This information should be provided by ray tracer callbacks when using @c IPL_SCENETYPE_CUSTOM. Not all fields are required.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Hit.Distance
member.summary: Distance along the ray from origin to hit point. Set to @c INFINITY if nothing was hit.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Hit.TriangleIndex
member.summary: (Optional) Index of the primitive hit by the ray. @c -1 if not provided.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Hit.ObjectIndex
member.summary: (Optional) Index of the scene object hit by the ray. @c -1 if not provided.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Hit.MaterialIndex
member.summary: (Optional) Index of the material associated with the primitive hit by the ray. @c -1 if not provided.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Hit.Normal
member.summary: Unit length surface normal at the hit point. Ignored if nothing was hit.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Hit.Material
member.summary: Pointer to the material at the hit point. Ignored if nothing was hit.

member.summary: 3-band reverb decay times (RT60). For @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_PARAMETRIC or @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_HYBRID.

member.summary: The TrueAudio Next device to use for convolution processing. For @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_TAN.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectParams.TanSlot
member.summary: The TrueAudio Next slot index to use for convolution processing. The slot identifies the IR to use. For @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_TAN.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectSettings
member.summary: Settings used to create a path effect.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectSettings.MaxOrder
member.summary: The maximum Ambisonics order that will be used by output audio buffers.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectSettings.Spatialize
member.summary: If @c IPL_TRUE, then this effect will render spatialized audio into the output buffer. If @c IPL_FALSE, this effect will render un-spatialized (and un-rotated) Ambisonic audio. Setting this to @c IPL_FALSE is mainly useful only if you plan to mix multiple Ambisonic buffers and/or apply additional processing to the Ambisonic audio before spatialization. If you plan to immediately spatialize the output of the path effect, setting this value to @c IPL_TRUE can result in significant performance improvements.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectSettings.SpeakerLayout
member.summary: The speaker layout to use when spatializing. Only used if @c spatialize is @c IPL_TRUE.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectSettings.Hrtf
member.summary: The HRTF to use when spatializing. Only used if @c spatialize is @c IPL_TRUE.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectParams
member.summary: Parameters for applying a path effect to an audio buffer.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectParams.EqCoeffs
member.summary: 3-band EQ coefficients for modeling frequency-dependent attenuation caused by paths bending around obstacles.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectParams.ShCoeffs
member.summary: Ambisonic coefficients for modeling the directional distribution of sound reaching the listener. The coefficients are specified in world-space, and must be rotated to match the listener's orientation separately.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectParams.Order
member.summary: Ambisonic order of the output buffer. May be less than the maximum order specified when creating the effect, in which case higher-order @c shCoeffs will be ignored, and CPU usage will be reduced.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectParams.Binaural
member.summary: If @c IPL_TRUE, spatialize using HRTF-based binaural rendering. Only used if @c spatialize was set to @c IPL_TRUE in @c IPLPathEffectSettings.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectParams.Hrtf
member.summary: The HRTF to use when spatializing. Only used if @c spatialize was set to @c IPL_TRUE in @c IPLPathEffectSettings and @c binaural is set to @c IPL_TRUE.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathEffectParams.Listener
member.summary: The position and orientation of the listener. Only used if @c spatialize was set to @c IPL_TRUE in @c IPLPathEffectSettings and @c binaural is set to @c IPL_TRUE.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationParams
member.summary: Settings used to generate probes.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationParams.Type
member.summary: The algorithm to use for generating probes.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationParams.Spacing
member.summary: Spacing (in meters) between two neighboring probes. Only for @c IPL_PROBEGENERATIONTYPE_UNIFORMFLOOR.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationParams.Height
member.summary: Height (in meters) above the floor at which probes will be generated. Only for @c IPL_PROBEGENERATIONTYPE_UNIFORMFLOOR.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ProbeGenerationParams.Transform
member.summary: A transformation matrix that transforms an axis-aligned unit cube, with minimum and maximum vertices at (0, 0, 0) and (1, 1, 1), into a parallelopiped volume. Probes will be generated within this volume.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataIdentifier
member.summary: Identifies a "layer" of data stored in a probe batch. Each probe batch may store multiple layers of data, such as reverb, static source reflections, or pathing. Each layer can be accessed using an identifier.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataIdentifier.Type
member.summary: The type of data stored.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataIdentifier.Variation
member.summary: The way in which source and listener positions depend on probe position.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.BakedDataIdentifier.EndpointInfluence
T:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams
member.summary: Parameters used to control how reflections data is baked.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.Scene
member.summary: The scene in which the probes exist.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.ProbeBatch
member.summary: A probe batch containing the probes at which reflections data should be baked.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.SceneType
member.summary: The type of scene being used.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.Identifier
member.summary: An identifier for the data layer that should be baked. The identifier determines what data is simulated and stored at each probe. If the probe batch already contains data with this identifier, it will be overwritten.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.BakeFlags
member.summary: The types of data to save for each probe.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.NumRays
member.summary: The number of rays to trace from each listener position when baking. Increasing this number results in improved accuracy, at the cost of increased bake times.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.NumDiffuseSamples
member.summary: The number of directions to consider when generating diffusely-reflected rays when baking. Increasing this number results in slightly improved accuracy of diffuse reflections.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.NumBounces
member.summary: The number of times each ray is reflected off of solid geometry. Increasing this number results in longer reverb tails and improved accuracy, at the cost of increased bake times.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.SimulatedDuration
member.summary: The length (in seconds) of the impulse responses to simulate. Increasing this number allows the baked data to represent longer reverb tails (and hence larger spaces), at the cost of increased memory usage while baking.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.SavedDuration
member.summary: The length (in seconds) of the impulse responses to save at each probe. Increasing this number allows the baked data to represent longer reverb tails (and hence larger spaces), at the cost of increased disk space usage and memory usage at run-time.
member.remarks: It may be useful to set @c savedDuration to be less than @c simulatedDuration, especially if you plan to use hybrid reverb for rendering baked reflections. This way, the parametric reverb data is estimated using a longer IR, resulting in more accurate estimation, but only the early part of the IR can be saved for subsequent rendering.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.Order
member.summary: Ambisonic order of the baked IRs.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.NumThreads
member.summary: Number of threads to use for baking.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.RayBatchSize
member.summary: If using custom ray tracer callbacks, this the number of rays that will be passed to the callbacks every time rays need to be traced.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.IrradianceMinDistance
F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.BakeBatchSize
member.summary: If using Radeon Rays or if @c identifier.variation is @c IPL_BAKEDDATAVARIATION_STATICLISTENER, this is the number of probes for which data is baked simultaneously.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.OpenCLDevice
member.summary: The OpenCL device, if using Radeon Rays.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionsBakeParams.RadeonRaysDevice
member.summary: The Radeon Rays device, if using Radeon Rays.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams
member.summary: Parameters used to control how pathing data is baked.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.Scene
member.summary: The scene in which the probes exist.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.ProbeBatch
member.summary: A probe batch containing the probes for which pathing data should be baked.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.Identifier
member.summary: An identifier for the data layer that should be baked. The identifier determines what data is simulated and stored at each probe. If the probe batch already contains data with this identifier, it will be overwritten.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.NumSamples
member.summary: Number of point samples to use around each probe when testing whether one probe can see another. To determine if two probes are mutually visible, numSamples * numSamples rays are traced, from each point sample of the first probe, to every other point sample of the second probe.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.Radius
member.summary: When testing for mutual visibility between a pair of probes, each probe is treated as a sphere of this radius (in meters), and point samples are generated within this sphere.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.Threshold
member.summary: When tracing rays to test for mutual visibility between a pair of probes, the fraction of rays that are unoccluded must be greater than this threshold for the pair of probes to be considered mutually visible.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.VisRange
member.summary: If the distance between two probes is greater than this value, the probes are not considered mutually visible. Increasing this value can result in simpler paths, at the cost of increased bake times.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.PathRange
member.summary: If the length of the path between two probes is greater than this value, the probes are considered to not have any path between them. Increasing this value allows sound to propagate over greater distances, at the cost of increased bake times and memory usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.PathBakeParams.NumThreads
member.summary: Number of threads to use for baking.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModel
member.summary: A distance attenuation model that can be used for modeling attenuation of sound over distance. Can be used with both direct and indirect sound propagation.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModel.Type
member.summary: The type of distance attenuation model to use.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModel.MinDistance
member.summary: When @c type is @c IPL_DISTANCEATTENUATIONTYPE_INVERSEDISTANCE, no distance attenuation is applied to any sound whose distance from the listener is less than this value.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModel.Callback
member.summary: When @c type is @c IPL_DISTANCEATTENUATIONTYPE_CALLBACK, this function will be called whenever Steam Audio needs to evaluate distance attenuation.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModel.UserData
member.summary: Pointer to arbitrary data that will be provided to the @c callback function whenever it is called. May be @c NULL.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.DistanceAttenuationModel.Dirty
member.summary: Set to @c IPL_TRUE to indicate that the distance attenuation model defined by the @c callback function has changed since the last time simulation was run. For example, the callback may be evaluating a curve defined in a GUI. If the user is editing the curve in real-time, set this to @c IPL_TRUE whenever the curve changes, so Steam Audio can update simulation results to match.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModel
member.summary: An air absorption model that can be used for modeling frequency-dependent attenuation of sound over distance.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModel.Type
member.summary: The type of air absorption model to use.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModel.Coefficients
member.summary: The exponential falloff coefficients to use when @c type is @c IPL_AIRABSORPTIONTYPE_EXPONENTIAL.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModel.Callback
member.summary: When @c type is @c IPL_AIRABSORPTIONTYPE_CALLBACK, this function will be called whenever Steam Audio needs to evaluate air absorption.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModel.UserData
member.summary: Pointer to arbitrary data that will be provided to the @c callback function whenever it is called. May be @c NULL.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.AirAbsorptionModel.Dirty
member.summary: Set to @c IPL_TRUE to indicate that the air absorption model defined by the @c callback function has changed since the last time simulation was run. For example, the callback may be evaluating a set of curves defined in a GUI. If the user is editing the curves in real-time, set this to @c IPL_TRUE whenever the curves change, so Steam Audio can update simulation results to match.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.Directivity
member.summary: A directivity pattern that can be used to model changes in sound intensity as a function of the source's orientation. Can be used with both direct and indirect sound propagation.
member.remarks: The default directivity model is a weighted dipole. This is a linear blend between an omnidirectional source (which emits sound with equal intensity in all directions), and a dipole oriented along the z-axis in the source's coordinate system (which focuses sound along the +z and -z axes). A callback function can be specified to implement any other arbitrary directivity pattern.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Directivity.DipoleWeight
member.summary: How much of the dipole to blend into the directivity pattern. @c 0 = pure omnidirectional, @c 1 = pure dipole. @c 0.5f results in a cardioid directivity pattern.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Directivity.DipolePower
member.summary: How "sharp" the dipole is. Higher values result in sound being focused within a narrower range of directions.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Directivity.Callback
member.summary: If non @c NULL, this function will be called whenever Steam Audio needs to evaluate a directivity pattern.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.Directivity.UserData
member.summary: Pointer to arbitrary data that will be provided to the @c callback function whenever it is called. May be @c NULL.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings
member.summary: Settings used to create a simulator.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.Flags
member.summary: The types of simulation that this simulator will be used for.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.SceneType
member.summary: The type of scene that will be used for simulations via @c iplSimulatorSetScene. The scene type cannot change during the lifetime of a simulator object.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.ReflectionType
member.summary: The type of reflections effect that will be used to render the results of reflections simulation. The reflections effect type cannot change during the lifetime of a simulator object.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.MaxNumOcclusionSamples
member.summary: The maximum number of point samples to consider when calculating occlusion using the volumetric occlusion algorithm. Different sources can use different numbers of samples, and the number of samples can change between simulation runs, but this is the maximum value. Increasing this value results in smoother occlusion transitions, at the cost of increased CPU usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.MaxNumRays
member.summary: The maximum number of rays to trace from the listener when simulating reflections. You can use different numbers of rays between simulation runs, but this is the maximum value. Increasing this value results in more accurate reflections, at the cost of increased CPU usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.NumDiffuseSamples
member.summary: The number of directions to sample when generating diffusely reflected rays. Increasing this value may increase the accuracy of diffuse reflections.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.MaxDuration
member.summary: The maximum length (in seconds) of impulse responses generated by reflection simulations. You can change this value betweeen simulation runs, but this is the maximum value. Increasing this value results in longer, more accurate reverb tails, at the cost of increased CPU and memory usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.MaxOrder
member.summary: The maximum Ambisonic order of impulse responses generated by reflection simulations. You can change this value between simulation runs, but this is the maximum value. Increasing this value results in more accurate directional variations in the impulse responses, at the cost of increased CPU and memory usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.MaxNumSources
member.summary: The maximum number of sources for which reflection simulations will be run at any given time.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.NumThreads
member.summary: The number of threads used for real-time reflection simulations.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.RayBatchSize
member.summary: If using custom ray tracer callbacks, this the number of rays that will be passed to the callbacks every time rays need to be traced.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.NumVisSamples
member.summary: The number of point samples to consider when calculating probe-to-probe visibility for pathing simulations. Baked paths may end up being occluded by dynamic objects, in which case you can configure the simulator to look for alternate paths in real time. This process will involve checking visibility between probes.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.SamplingRate
member.summary: The sampling rate (in Hz) used for audio processing.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.FrameSize
member.summary: The size (in samples) of the audio buffers used for audio processing.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.OpenCLDevice
member.summary: The OpenCL device being used. Only necessary if @sceneType is @c IPL_SCENETYPE_RADEONRAYS, or @c reflectionType is @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_TAN.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.RadeonRaysDevice
member.summary: The Radeon Rays device being used. Only necessary if @sceneType is @c IPL_SCENETYPE_RADEONRAYS.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSettings.TanDevice
member.summary: The TrueAudio Next device being used. Only necessary if @c reflectionType is @c IPL_REFLECTIONEFFECTTYPE_TAN.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.SourceSettings
member.summary: Settings used to create a source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SourceSettings.Flags
member.summary: The types of simulation that may be run for this source.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs
member.summary: Simulation parameters for a source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.Flags
member.summary: The types of simulation to run for this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.DirectFlags
member.summary: The types of direct simulation to run for this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.Source
member.summary: The position and orientation of this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.DistanceAttenuationModel
member.summary: The distance attenuation model to use for this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.AirAbsorptionModel
member.summary: The air absorption model to use for this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.Directivity
member.summary: The directivity pattern to use for this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.OcclusionType
member.summary: The occlusion algorithm to use for this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.OcclusionRadius
member.summary: If using volumetric occlusion, the source is modeled as a sphere with this radius.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.NumOcclusionSamples
member.summary: If using volumetric occlusion, this is the number of point samples to consider when tracing rays. This value can change between simulation runs.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.ReverbScale
member.summary: If using parametric or hybrid reverb for rendering reflections, the reverb decay times for each frequency band are scaled by these values. Set to @c {1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f} to use the simulated values without modification.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.HybridReverbTransitionTime
member.summary: If using hybrid reverb for rendering reflections, this is the length (in seconds) of impulse response to use for convolution reverb. The rest of the impulse response will be used for parametric reverb estimation only. Increasing this value results in more accurate reflections, at the cost of increased CPU usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.HybridReverbOverlapPercent
member.summary: If using hybrid reverb for rendering reflections, this is the amount of overlap between the convolution and parametric parts. To ensure smooth transitions from the early convolution part to the late parametric part, the two are cross-faded towards the end of the convolution part. For example, if @c hybridReverbTransitionTime is @c 1.0f, and @c hybridReverbOverlapPercent is @c 0.25f, then the first 0.75 seconds are pure convolution, the next 0.25 seconds are a blend between convolution and parametric, and the portion of the tail beyond 1.0 second is pure parametric.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.Baked
member.summary: If @c IPL_TRUE, this source will used baked data for reflections simulation.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.BakedDataIdentifier
member.summary: The identifier used to specify which layer of baked data to use for simulating reflections for this source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.PathingProbes
member.summary: The probe batch within which to find paths from this source to the listener.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.VisRadius
member.summary: When testing for mutual visibility between a pair of probes, each probe is treated as a sphere of this radius (in meters), and point samples are generated within this sphere.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.VisThreshold
member.summary: When tracing rays to test for mutual visibility between a pair of probes, the fraction of rays that are unoccluded must be greater than this threshold for the pair of probes to be considered mutually visible.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.VisRange
member.summary: If the distance between two probes is greater than this value, the probes are not considered mutually visible. Increasing this value can result in simpler paths, at the cost of increased CPU usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.PathingOrder
member.summary: If simulating pathing, this is the Ambisonic order used for representing path directionality. Higher values result in more precise spatialization of paths, at the cost of increased CPU usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.EnableValidation
member.summary: If @c IPL_TRUE, baked paths are tested for visibility. This is useful if your scene has dynamic objects that might occlude baked paths.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.FindAlternatePaths
member.summary: If @c IPL_TRUE, and @c enableValidation is @c IPL_TRUE, then if a baked path is occluded by dynamic geometry, path finding is re-run in real-time to find alternate paths that take into account the dynamic geometry.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationInputs.NumTransmissionRays
member.summary: If simulating transmission, this is the maximum number of surfaces, starting from the closest surface to the listener, whose transmission coefficients will be considered when calculating the total amount of sound transmitted. Increasing this value will result in more accurate results when multiple surfaces lie between the source and the listener, at the cost of increased CPU usage.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs
member.summary: Simulation parameters that are not specific to any source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.Listener
member.summary: The position and orientation of the listener.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.NumRays
member.summary: The number of rays to trace from the listener. Increasing this value results in more accurate reflections, at the cost of increased CPU usage.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.NumBounces
member.summary: The number of times each ray traced from the listener is reflected when it encounters a solid object. Increasing this value results in longer, more accurate reverb tails, at the cost of increased CPU usage during simulation.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.Duration
member.summary: The duration (in seconds) of the impulse responses generated when simulating reflections. Increasing this value results in longer, more accurate reverb tails, at the cost of increased CPU usage during audio processing.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.Order
member.summary: The Ambisonic order of the impulse responses generated when simulating reflections. Increasing this value results in more accurate directional variation of reflected sound, at the cost of increased CPU usage during audio processing.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.IrradianceMinDistance
F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.PathingVisCallback
member.summary: Callback for visualizing valid path segments during call to @c iplSimulatorRunPathing.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationSharedInputs.PathingUserData
member.summary: Pointer to arbitrary user-specified data provided when calling the function that will call this callback.

member.name: T:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationOutputs
member.summary: Simulation results for a source.

member.name: F:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulationOutputs.Direct
member.summary: Direct path simulation results.

member.summary: Reflection simulation results.

member.summary: Pathing simulation results.

member.summary: Saves a scene to an OBJ file.

Absolute or relative path to the OBJ file to generate.
member.remarks: An OBJ file is a widely-supported 3D model file format, that can be displayed using a variety of software on most PC platforms. The OBJ file generated by this function can be useful for detecting problems that occur when exporting scene data from your application to Steam Audio.*This function can only be called on a scene created with @c IPL_SCENETYPE_DEFAULT or @c IPL_SCENETYPE_EMBREE.**

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.SceneCommit(SteamAudio.IPL.Scene)
member.summary: Commits any changes to the scene.
member.param: The scene to commit changes to.
member.remarks: This function should be called after any calls to the following functions, for the changes to take effect:- @c iplStaticMeshAdd - @c iplStaticMeshRemove - @c iplInstancedMeshAdd - @c iplInstancedMeshRemove - @c iplInstancedMeshUpdateTransformFor best performance, call this function once after all changes have been made for a given frame.*This function cannot be called concurrently with any simulation functions.**

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMeshCreate(SteamAudio.IPL.Scene,SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMeshSettings@,SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMesh@)
member.summary: Creates a static mesh.
member.param: The scene in which the static mesh should be created.
The settings to use when creating the static mesh.
[out] The created static mesh.
member.returns: Status code indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.
member.remarks: A static mesh represents a triangle mesh that does not change after it is created. A static mesh also contains an array of acoustic material properties, and a mapping between each of its triangles and their acoustic material properties.Static mesh objects should be used for scene geometry that is guaranteed to never change, such as rooms, buildings, or triangulated terrain. A scene may contain multiple static meshes, although typically one is sufficient.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMeshLoad(SteamAudio.IPL.Scene,SteamAudio.IPL.SerializedObject,SteamAudio.IPL.ProgressCallback,System.IntPtr,SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMesh@)
member.summary: Loads a static mesh from a serialized object. Typically, the serialized object will be created from a byte array loaded from disk or over the network.
member.param: The scene in which the static mesh should be created.
The serialized object from which to load the scene.
Callback that reports the percentage of this function's work that has been completed. May be @c NULL.
Pointer to arbitrary data that will be passed to the progress callback. May be @c NULL.
[out] The created static mesh.
member.returns: Status code indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMeshSave(SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMesh,SteamAudio.IPL.SerializedObject)
member.summary: Saves a static mesh to a serialized object. Typically, the serialized object will then be saved to disk.
member.param: The static mesh to save.
The serialized object into which to save the static mesh.
member.remarks: This function can only be called on a static mesh that is part of a scene created with @c IPL_SCENETYPE_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMeshAdd(SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMesh,SteamAudio.IPL.Scene)
member.summary: Adds a static mesh to a scene.
member.param: The static mesh to add.
The scene to which to add the static mesh. This must be the scene which was passed when calling @c iplStaticMeshCreate.
member.remarks: This function should be called after @c iplStaticMeshCreate, or at any point after @c iplStaticMeshRemove, for the static mesh to start affecting sound propagation.After calling this function, @c iplSceneCommit must be called for the changes to take effect.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMeshRemove(SteamAudio.IPL.StaticMesh,SteamAudio.IPL.Scene)
member.summary: Removes a static mesh from a scene.
member.param: The static mesh to remove.
The scene from which to remove the static mesh. This must be the scene which was passed when calling @c iplStaticMeshCreate.
member.remarks: After this function is called, the static mesh will stop affecting sound propagation, until it is added back using @c iplStaticMeshAdd.After calling this function, @c iplSceneCommit must be called for the changes to take effect.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMeshCreate(SteamAudio.IPL.Scene,SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMeshSettings@,SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMesh@)
member.summary: Creates an instanced mesh.
member.param: The scene in which the instanced mesh should be created.
The settings used to create the instanced mesh.
[out] The created instanced mesh.
member.returns: Status code indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.
member.remarks: An instanced mesh takes one scene and positions it within another scene. This is useful if you have the same object, like a pillar, that you want to instantiate multiple times within the same scene. A scene can be instantiated multiple times within another scene, without incurring any significant memory overhead.The instanced mesh can be moved, rotated, and scaled freely at any time, providing an easy way to implement dynamic objects whose motion can be described purely in terms of rigid-body transformations.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMeshRetain(SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMesh)
member.summary: Retains an additional reference to a instanced mesh.
member.param: The instanced mesh to retain a reference to.
member.returns: The additional reference to the instanced mesh.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMeshRelease(SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMesh@)
member.summary: Releases a reference to a instanced mesh.
member.param: The instanced mesh to release a reference to.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMeshAdd(SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMesh,SteamAudio.IPL.Scene)
member.summary: Adds an instanced mesh to a scene.
member.param: The instanced mesh to add.
The scene to which to add the instanced mesh. This must be the scene which was passed when calling @c iplInstancedMeshCreate.
member.remarks: This function should be called after @c iplInstancedMeshCreate, or at any point after @c iplInstancedMeshRemove, for the instanced mesh to start affecting sound propagation.After calling this function, @c iplSceneCommit must be called for the changes to take effect.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMeshRemove(SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMesh,SteamAudio.IPL.Scene)
member.summary: Removes an instanced mesh from a scene.
member.param: The instanced mesh to remove.
The scene from which to remove the instanced mesh. This must be the scene which was passed when calling @c iplInstancedMeshCreate.
member.remarks: After this function is called, the instanced mesh will stop affecting sound propagation, until it is added back using @c iplInstancedMeshAdd.After calling this function, @c iplSceneCommit must be called for the changes to take effect.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMeshUpdateTransform(SteamAudio.IPL.InstancedMesh,SteamAudio.IPL.Scene,SteamAudio.IPL.Matrix4x4)
member.summary: Updates the local-to-world transform of an instanced mesh within its parent scene.
member.param: The instanced mesh whose transform is to be updated.
The parent scene that contains the instanced mesh.
The new 4x4 local-to-world transform matrix.
member.remarks: This function allows the instanced mesh to be moved, rotated, and scaled dynamically.After calling this function, @c iplSceneCommit must be called for the changes to take effect.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBufferAllocate(SteamAudio.IPL.Context,System.Int32,System.Int32,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@)
member.summary: Allocates an audio buffer.
member.param: The context used to initialize Steam Audio.
Number of channels.
Number of samples per channel.
The audio buffer to allocate.
member.returns: Status code indicating whether or not the operation succeeded.
member.remarks: All audio buffers are uncompressed PCM with 32-bit floating-point samples.Internally, all audio buffers are stored deinterleaved for performance reasons. If your audio engine provides interleaved audio buffers, you must use @c iplAudioBufferInterleave and @c iplAudioBufferDeinterleave to explicitly convert to/from deinterleaved format. If your audio engine provides deinterleaved audio buffers, you can pass them directly using @c IPLAudioBuffer, thus avoiding the processing and memory overhead of an extra audio buffer.

member.summary: Frees an audio buffer.
member.param: The audio buffer to free.
The context used to initialize Steam Audio.

member.summary: Reads samples from an audio buffer and interleaves them into a user-provided array.
member.param: The context used to initialize Steam Audio.
The audio buffer to read from.
The interleaved array to write into.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBufferDeinterleave(SteamAudio.IPL.Context,System.Single@,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@)
member.summary: Writes interleaved samples from a user-provided array into an audio buffer.
member.param: The context used to initialize Steam Audio.
The interleaved array to read from.
The audio buffer to write into.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBufferMix(SteamAudio.IPL.Context,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@)
member.summary: Mixes one audio buffer into another.
member.param: The context used to initialize Steam Audio.
The source audio buffer.
The destination audio buffer, into which the source should be mixed.
member.remarks: Both audio buffers must have the same number of channels and samples.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBufferDownmix(SteamAudio.IPL.Context,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@)
member.summary: Downmixes a multi-channel audio buffer into a mono audio buffer.
member.param: The context used to initialize Steam Audio.
The source audio buffer.
The destination audio buffer.
member.remarks: Both audio buffers must have the same number of samples.Downmixing is performed by summing up the source channels and dividing the result by the number of source channels. If this is not the desired downmixing behavior, we recommend that downmixing be performed manually.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBufferConvertAmbisonics(SteamAudio.IPL.Context,SteamAudio.IPL.AmbisonicsType,SteamAudio.IPL.AmbisonicsType,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@)
member.summary: Converts an Ambisonic audio buffer from one Ambisonic format to another.
member.param: The context used to initialize Steam Audio.
Ambisonic format of @c in.
Ambisonic format that @c out should be in.
The source audio buffer.
The destination audio buffer.
member.remarks: Both audio buffers must have the same number of samples.This conversion can be applied in-place, i.e., @c in and @c out can be the same audio buffer.Steam Audio's "native" Ambisonic format is N3D, so for best performance, keep all Ambisonic data in N3D format except when exchanging data with your audio engine.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectApply(SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffect,SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionEffectParams@,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@,SteamAudio.IPL.AudioBuffer@,SteamAudio.IPL.ReflectionMixer)
member.summary: Applies a reflection effect to an audio buffer.
member.param: The reflection effect to apply.
Parameters for applying the effect.
The input audio buffer. Must have 1 channel.
The output audio buffer. Must have as many channels as the impulse response specified when creating the effect (for convolution, hybrid, and TAN) or at least 1 channel (for parametric).

If this is non-null, then the output of this effect will be mixed into the given mixer object instead of being returned in the @c out parameter. The mixed output can be retrieved elsewhere in the audio pipeline using @c iplReflectionMixerApply. This can have a performance benefit if using convolution. If using TAN, specifying a mixer is required.
member.returns: @c IPL_AUDIOEFFECTSTATE_TAILREMAINING if any tail samples remain in the effect's internal buffers, or @c IPL_AUDIOEFFECTSTATE_TAILCOMPLETE otherwise.
member.remarks: This effect CANNOT be applied in-place.

member.returns: The number of tail samples remaining.
member.remarks: Tail samples are audio samples that should be played even after the input to the effect has stopped playing and no further input samples are available.

member.param: The reflection effect.

If this is non-null, then the tail samples will be mixed into the given mixer object instead of being returned in the @c out parameter. The mixed output can be retrieved elsewhere in the audio pipeline using @c iplReflectionMixerApply. This can have a performance benefit if using convolution. If using TAN, specifying a mixer is required.
member.returns: @c IPL_AUDIOEFFECTSTATE_TAILREMAINING if any tail samples remain in the effect's internal buffers, or @c IPL_AUDIOEFFECTSTATE_TAILCOMPLETE otherwise.

The types of simulation for which to specify shared inputs. If, for example, direct and reflections simulations are being run on separate threads, you can call this function on the direct simulation thread with @c IPL_SIMULATIONFLAGS_DIRECT, and on the reflections simulation thread with @c IPL_SIMULATIONFLAGS_REFLECTIONS, without requiring any synchronization between the calls.
The shared input parameters to set.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulatorCommit(SteamAudio.IPL.Simulator)
member.summary: Commits changes to the scene or probe batches used for simulation.
member.param: The simulator being used.
member.remarks: Call this function after calling @c iplSimulatorSetScene, @c iplSimulatorAddProbeBatch, or @c iplSimulatorRemoveProbeBatch for the changes to take effect.This function cannot be called while any simulation is running.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulatorRunDirect(SteamAudio.IPL.Simulator)
member.summary: Runs a direct simulation for all sources added to the simulator. This may include distance attenuation, air absorption, directivity, occlusion, and transmission.
member.param: The simulator being used.
member.remarks: This function should not be called from the audio processing thread if occlusion and/or transmission are enabled.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulatorRunReflections(SteamAudio.IPL.Simulator)
member.summary: Runs a reflections simulation for all sources added to the simulator.
member.param: The simulator being used.
member.remarks: This function can be CPU intensive, and should be called from a separate thread in order to not block either the audio processing thread or the game's main update thread.

member.name: M:SteamAudio.IPL.SimulatorRunPathing(SteamAudio.IPL.Simulator)
member.summary: Runs a pathing simulation for all sources added to the simulator.
member.param: The simulator being used.
member.remarks: This function can be CPU intensive, and should be called from a separate thread in order to not block either the audio processing thread or the game's main update thread.
